newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat ends lower, July posts broad losses.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat ends lower, July posts broad losses.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures settled lower and new crop contracts posted broad losses amid fund- and technical-related selling, traders said.

Early fund-related selling in July wheat triggered sell-stops, which pushed the market sharply lower at the midsession. A late bout of short covering helped erase some earlier losses, but the rally lost steam and the July contract tumbled four cents in the session's final five minutes.
Traders said various forecasts for much-needed rain next week in dry areas of western Kansas and eastern Colorado weighed on the July contract.
"We saw fund-selling early and then stops were hit," a trader said. "It's also a little bearish if we get rain next week (in western Kansas) as is being forecast."
KCBT wheat settled 1/2 to 12 cents per bushel lower, and July traded in a 16-1/2 cent range before closing down 12 cents at $4.16-1/4.
Strong cash basis bids for old crop wheat helped limit losses in the May contract. May settled down three cents at $4.55.

Brokerage house Refco, which has ties to fund holdings, was easily the session's featured player. Traders said Refco sold six million KCBT July bushels, and ADM's Benson-Quinn Commodities sold four million July and one million September.
